media:group.media:title: Internet Beggar Hates Bitcoin
media:group.media:description:
Join Bitcoin University Premium:
https://www.bitcoinuniversity.com

In this video, I discuss Wikipedia founder Jimmy Wales's comment on Bitcoin and banks.

Jimmy Wales betrays his first world privilege when he extols banks at the expense of Bitcoin. What about the 1.3 billion unbanked people on the planet?

So why Bitcoin, and not banks?

-- Bitcoin never got a banker bonus, while you got your house foreclosed on
-- Bitcoin doesn't depend on government bailouts
-- Bitcoin doesn't do bank holidays or 4-martini lunches
-- Bitcoin is open 24/7/365
-- When you want to access your funds, Bitcoin never asks you what you need the money for
-- Bitcoin won't freeze your money when you exercise your right to free speech
-- Bitcoin won't freeze your money when hyperinflation hits

Bitcoiners should do their best to ignore and defund institutions, politicians, celebrities, etc who go out of their way to attack Bitcoin like Jimmy Wales did. At this point, Wikipedia is a highly politicized and wasteful project that enriches itself while unpaid volunteers do most of the work.

Not investment advice! Consult a financial advisor.
